channel.description: Twitter feed for: @emilianobonassi. Generated by nitter.freedit.eu

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: It doesn’t cost $10 million to launch a rollup.
But more importantly, you’re thinking about rollup costs all wrong.
Study Nvidia. Study Jensen Huang.
“Our total cost of operations is so good that even when competitors’ chips are free, it’s not cheap enough.”
item.dc:creator: @KAndrewHuang
item.description:
It doesn’t cost $10 million to launch a rollup.

But more importantly, you’re thinking about rollup costs all wrong.

Study Nvidia. Study Jensen Huang.

“Our total cost of operations is so good that even when competitors’ chips are free, it’s not cheap enough.”

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: 🔈Announce 🚀ZK Security Framework🚀
ZKPs are revolutionizing privacy and security, but they also introduce new attack surfaces. To address these challenges, @salus_sec & @zerobasezk have launched the ZK Security Framework—a structured approach to analyzing ZKP vulnerabilities, providing security audit checklists, and offering mitigation strategies to help developers build more secure ZK systems.
🔍 Key Security Risks ✅ Completeness Issues: Over-constrained circuits may cause verification failures ✅ Soundness Issues: Under-constrained circuits can allow attackers to forge proofs ✅ Information Leakage: Trusted setup leaks may lead to stolen assets ✅ Arithmetic Overflows: Improper field arithmetic can be exploited
📊 ZK Risk Classification 🔴 High Risk: Proof forgery (e.g., Frozen Heart attack) 🟡 Medium Risk: Unintended exposure of private inputs 🔵 Low Risk: Interfaces that are prone to misuse ⚫ Informational: Redundant constraints in logical
Operations More than just an audit checklist, the ZK Security Framework serves as an essential learning resource for developers and security researchers. A huge thank you to the @ethereum & @EF_ESP team for their invaluable support! 🙌Without you, we wouldn't be able to complete it !
Explore now 👉 GitHub: https://github.com/Salusec/zksecurity-framework/
item.dc:creator: @mirrorzk
item.description:
🔈Announce 🚀ZK Security Framework🚀

ZKPs are revolutionizing privacy and security, but they also introduce new attack surfaces. To address these challenges, @salus_sec & @zerobasezk have launched the ZK Security Framework—a structured approach to analyzing ZKP vulnerabilities, providing security audit checklists, and offering mitigation strategies to help developers build more secure ZK systems.

🔍 Key Security Risks
✅ Completeness Issues: Over-constrained circuits may cause verification failures
✅ Soundness Issues: Under-constrained circuits can allow attackers to forge proofs
✅ Information Leakage: Trusted setup leaks may lead to stolen assets
✅ Arithmetic Overflows: Improper field arithmetic can be exploited

📊 ZK Risk Classification
🔴 High Risk: Proof forgery (e.g., Frozen Heart attack) 🟡 Medium Risk: Unintended exposure of private inputs
🔵 Low Risk: Interfaces that are prone to misuse
⚫ Informational: Redundant constraints in logical

Operations
More than just an audit checklist, the ZK Security Framework serves as an essential learning resource for developers and security researchers.
A huge thank you to the @ethereum & @EF_ESP team for their invaluable support! 🙌Without you, we wouldn't be able to complete it !

Explore now 👉 GitHub: github.com/Salusec/zksecurit…

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: Let's talk Delayed Execution.
Together with @fradamt, we've published a post exploring a potential implementation and its impact on scaling Ethereum's Layer 1.
🔗 Read the full post here: https://ethresear.ch/t/delayed-execution-and-skipped-transactions/21677
If you want a quick summary, here's the TL;DR 🧵👇

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: Introducing zkFOCIL, a protocol for private Ethereum inclusion lists! Based on FOCIL (EIP-7805) and powered by Linkable Ring Signatures, validators publish inclusion lists privately without revealing their identity.
by @asn_d6, Benedikt and @soispoke
https://ethresear.ch/t/zkfocil-inclusion-list-privacy-using-linkable-ring-signatures/21688/1

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: Pectra is going live 🥳
Holesky will fork at slot 3710976 (Mon, Feb 24 at 21:55:12 UTC) Sepolia will fork at slot 7118848 (Wed, Mar 5 at 07:29:36 UTC)
Assuming Sepolia goes smoothly, we'll pick the mainnet slot on the March 6 ACD call 📅
item.dc:creator: @TimBeiko
item.description:
Pectra is going live 🥳

Holesky will fork at slot 3710976 (Mon, Feb 24 at 21:55:12 UTC)
Sepolia will fork at slot 7118848 (Wed, Mar 5 at 07:29:36 UTC)

Assuming Sepolia goes smoothly, we'll pick the mainnet slot on the March 6 ACD call 📅

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: How Things Work #0: ZODA and the Accidental Computer
Today, we explore how Data Availability Sampling (DAS) can scale blockchains with @alexhevans and @GuilleAngeris from @BainCapCrypto.
Turns out, you can (somehow) embed verifiable computations over data in DA into DA 🪄.
item.dc:creator: @commonwarexyz
item.description:
How Things Work #0: ZODA and the Accidental Computer

Today, we explore how Data Availability Sampling (DAS) can scale blockchains with @alexhevans and @GuilleAngeris from @BainCapCrypto.

Turns out, you can (somehow) embed verifiable computations over data in DA into DA 🪄.

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: 2025 prediction: Rollups will embrace ZK and unlock interoperability across Ethereum and its L2s.
ZK has never been easier to implement with tools like @SuccinctLabs OP-Succinct and @RISCZero Kailua.
This is Ethereum’s secret weapon against the “Ethereum killers.”
item.dc:creator: @conduitxyz
item.description:
2025 prediction: Rollups will embrace ZK and unlock interoperability across Ethereum and its L2s.

ZK has never been easier to implement with tools like @SuccinctLabs OP-Succinct and @RISCZero Kailua.

This is Ethereum’s secret weapon against the “Ethereum killers.”
